intro: Licania calvescens, commonly known as the Brazilian candlewood, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Licania calvescens is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local medicine.
